criterion: Provides a clear explanation of the relationship between back pain and physical condition.
Mentions that back pain can be caused by muscle strain or poor posture.
Asks the user about any recent changes in their daily activities or work habits.
Uses natural language and avoids technical jargon.
Recommends a specific exercise or stretching routine to alleviate back pain.
Fails to mention that back pain can be a symptom of a serious underlying medical condition.
Provides overly complicated or professional medical information.
Does not suggest seeking medical attention if the user experiences severe or persistent back pain.
Mentions that back pain is not a common condition.
Asks the user if they have tried any self-care techniques to alleviate their back pain.
Provides a detailed explanation of the anatomy of the spine.
Fails to provide any guidance on how to prevent back pain.
